intro: [WRONG START] Phyllanthus gardnerianianus var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It features small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
